page.title: 09LUNAN, HOUSING ARCITECTURE.
page.content: The housing in this area is varied. There are the larger houses, usually farm houses, the farm cottages, old cottages which have been very attractively renovated, the local authority houses and new bungalows.There is a mixture of home ownership and rented property. The farm cottages not required for farm workers are rented privately. Some of the local authority tenants have recently taken up the option of purchasing their houses. Of Architectural Interest is the Lunan Bay hotel. This was originaly a Georgian Mansion House, of which it is a fine example.It was built in 1815 and extended in 1850 by the Blair Imrie family who also laid out the most attractive grounds.
